title: India Monsoon Rains LIVE: IMD Warns of Heavy Downpour in Telangana for Next 72 Hours, Rain Batters Delhi & Himachal - BizzBuzz
article_text:
Home
National
India Monsoon Rains LIVE: IMD Warns of Heavy Downpour in Telangana for Next 72 Hours, Rain Batters Delhi & Himachal

IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rains in Telangana over the next 72 hours, while monsoon showers continue to lash Himachal Pradesh, Delhi, Andhra Pradesh, and Odisha, prompting alerts and safety measures across states.

Waterlogging at GTK Road, New Delhi, after overnight monsoon showers on August 12, 2025.

By Admin 5

13 Aug 2025 10:50 AM IST

Telangana is under a heavy rain alert from the India Meteorological Department (IMD), which predicts strong showers throughout the state beginning on Wednesday, August 13 and lasting for the next 72 hours.

Officials have been directed by Chief Minister Revanth Reddy to put in place stringent safety protocols, stop traffic on flooded bridges, canals, and low-lying causeways, and take action to prevent fatalities.

The death toll from the unrelenting monsoon rains in Himachal Pradesh has risen to 240. The State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA) reports that 141 water supply schemes, 320 roads, and 198 electrical transformers are still affected.

Tuesday night, the national capital saw a lot of rain, which caused waterlogging in a number of places. The IMD predicted a mostly cloudy sky with occasional rain or thundershowers, and Delhi recorded a minimum temperature of 26.8¬∞C on Wednesday morning. At 9 a.m., the air quality index (AQI) was 112 (moderate), and the highest temperature is predicted to reach 33¬∞C.

Local Weather Reports:

Andhra Pradesh: Eluru, Palnadu, Prakasam, Visakhapatnam, Anakapalli, Kakinada, East & West Godavari, SPSR Nellore, YSR Kadapa, Chittoor, and Annamayya districts are all expected to see some light rain. A yellow alert has been issued for thunderstorms, lightning, and high winds.

Telangana: Irrigation Minister N. Uttam Kumar Reddy has instructed officials to monitor irrigation projects, reservoirs, and canals closely. Any sign of damage or breach must be reported immediately to the authorities.

Odisha: Heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected over the next three days, especially around Independence Day, due to a possible low-pressure system forming over the Bay of Bengal. IMD officials warn of thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds across several districts.

Authorities across states are urging citizens to stay alert, avoid unnecessary travel in flood-prone zones, and follow weather advisories closely.

title: IMD issues red alert for Uttarakhand, Telangana; 43 still missing in Dharali - CNBC TV18
article_text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert on Wednesday, August 13, predicting heavy rains in Jammu and Kashmir, Uttarakhand, and Telangana. The Met Office also issued an orange alert for Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Sikkim, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and parts of Maharashtra.In its weather bulletin, IMD predicted heavy rains in several states across the country until August 18.The weather agency issued a red alert for Jammu and Kashmir, predicting heavy rains today. It also forecasts heavy rainfall in parts of the state until Friday, along with downpours on Wednesday and Thursday.The IMD has issued a red alert for five districts in Telangana, an orange alert in nine districts, and a yellow alert in five districts today. Hanumakonda, Jangaon, Mahabubabad, Warangal and Yadadri Bhongir are expected to receive heavy rains today.Similar warnings are there for Bhadradri Kothagudem, Hyderabad, Medchal Malkajgiri, Rangareddy, Jayashankar Bhupalpally, Karimnagar, Mulugu, Peddapalli and Siddipet districts.Heavy rains are expected for Adilabad, Jagtial, Kumaram Bheem Asifabad, Mancherial and Rajanna Sircilla districts.The Delhi-NCR and surrounding areas may see cloudy skies on Wednesday, along with one or two spells of showers, likely to occur during the evening and night.On August 13, heavy rains lashed Mumbai; isolated heavy showers are predicted across Madhya Maharashtra till August 18.The Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) in Mumbai predicted heavy rainfall in some sections of the south Konkan-Goa districts, isolated spots in the north Konkan districts, and the Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra ghats.The IMD announced on Wednesday that certain places in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Bihar, West Bengal, and Sikkim have a 'low to moderate' flash flood danger, with heavy rainfall forecast today.Amid heavy rainfall in the state, the death toll in Himachal Pradesh has climbed to 240. As per the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA), these figures include 125 fatalities in rain-related incidents and 115 deaths in road accidents.On Tuesday, authorities continued air operations for the seventh consecutive day to rescue residents trapped in the villages of Dharali and Harsil in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand, where flash floods struck on August 5, causing massive destruction and loss of life and property.According to the latest official update, 43 individuals remain missing due to the flash floods.

NewsCitiesAhmedabadIMD predicts heavy rain in Gujarat from Aug 15
IMD predicts heavy rain in Gujarat from Aug 15
On August 17, heavy rainfall is expected in the districts of Anand, Panchmahal, Dahod, Mahisagar, Vadodara, Chhota Udepur, Narmada, Bharuch, Surat, Dang, Tapi, Navsari and Valsad, the IMD said.¬†
By: Express News Service
Ahmedabad | August 13, 2025 02:23 IST
2 min read
‚ÄúHeavy rain is very likely in the districts of Panchmahal, Dahod, Vadodara, Chhota Udepur, Narmada, Bharuch, Surat, Dang, Tapi, Navsari and Valsad on August 18 and in the Saurashtra districts of Amreli, Bhavnagar and Gir Somnath,‚Äù the IMD said.

AFTER a break, the Southwest monsoon is expected to become active, bringing heavy rainfall in several parts of Gujarat from August 15 onwards, according to the IMD.

Owing to the upper air cyclonic circulation over central parts of Bay of Bengal, a low pressure area is likely to form over westcentral and adjoining northwest Bay of Bengal on August 13 and become more marked during subsequent 48 hours, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said in its bulletin on Tuesday.

According to the IMD, while light thunderstorm with lightning and surface wind 30-40 kmph accompanied with light to moderate rain is very likely across Gujarat on August 15 and 16, heavy rain is expected in the districts of Panchmahal, Dahod, Vadodara, Chhota Udepur, Narmada, Bharuch, Surat, Dang, Tapi, Navsari, Valsad on August 16.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

On August 17, heavy rainfall is expected in the districts of Anand, Panchmahal, Dahod, Mahisagar, Vadodara, Chhota Udepur, Narmada, Bharuch, Surat, Dang, Tapi, Navsari and Valsad, the IMD said.

‚ÄúHeavy rain is very likely in the districts of Panchmahal, Dahod, Vadodara, Chhota Udepur, Narmada, Bharuch, Surat, Dang, Tapi, Navsari and¬† Valsad on August 18 and in the Saurashtra¬† districts of Amreli, Bhavnagar and Gir Somnath,‚Äù the IMD said.

title: Hyderabad Rain Update: IMD Warns of More Heavy Showers Across City - BizzBuzz
article_text:
Home
Telangana State
Hyderabad Rain Update: IMD Warns of More Heavy Showers Across City

IMD Hyderabad forecasts more heavy rainfall as low-pressure system drives continuous monsoon showers across Hyderabad and Telangana districts.

image for illustrative purpose

By Sowmya Sangam

13 Aug 2025 10:10 AM IST

Hyderabad weather turned wet on Wednesday morning as non-stop rain from an active low-pressure area (LPA) over central India continued to affect large parts of Telangana. Moisture from the Bay of Bengal monsoon system is driving fresh spells of heavy rainfall in Hyderabad and surrounding districts.

Early morning Hyderabad rain slowed peak-hour traffic in several parts of the city, with areas such as Mehdipatnam, Khairatabad, LB Nagar, and Kukatpally reporting waterlogging. IMD Hyderabad has forecast more moderate to heavy showers during the day, with a possibility of intense rainfall in the evening.

The Telangana weather forecast indicates that the current monsoon rains are linked to a strong low-pressure system that has already brought widespread rainfall to Kumurambheem-Asifabad, Mancherial, Jagitial, Peddapalli, Bhupalapally, Rajanna Sircilla, Karimnagar, Siddipet, Hanmakonda, Warangal, and Mulugu. Southern districts, including Yadadri-Bhuvanagiri, Rangareddy, Nalgonda, Nagarkurnool, and Suryapet, have also recorded heavy showers.

Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) officials have advised commuters to check Hyderabad traffic updates before travelling and to avoid flood-prone stretches during peak rain hours. Disaster response teams and drainage maintenance units are on standby to address waterlogging issues.

title: Hyderabad Rain Update: IMD Issues Red Alert for Telangana Districts - BizzBuzz
article_text:
Home
Telangana State
Hyderabad Rain Update: IMD Issues Red Alert for Telangana Districts

Hyderabad rain alert issued by IMD. Telangana districts to see heavy to extremely heavy rainfall. Stay informed on Telangana weather forecast and alerts.

image for illustrative purpose

By Sowmya Sangam

13 Aug 2025 10:00 AM IST

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Telangana covering multiple districts, including Hyderabad, warning of very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall over the next two days.

The Telangana weather forecast also includes an orange alert for parts of the state on Friday and Saturday.

According to the IMD Telangana monsoon update, Wednesday is expected to see very heavy to extremely heavy rain at isolated places in Hanmakonda, Jangaon, Mahabubabad, Warangal, and Yadadri Bhuvanagiri districts.

On Thursday, similar conditions are likely in Medak, Sangareddy, and Vikarabad districts, as part of the continuing Telangana rainfall alert.

Heavy to very heavy rainfall on Wednesday is also forecast for Bhadradri Kothagudem, Hyderabad, Jayashankar Bhupalpally, Karimnagar, Medchal‚ÄìMalkajgiri, Mulugu, Peddapalli, Ranga Reddy, and Siddipet.

The Hyderabad rain warning also extends to Adilabad, Jagtial, Komaram Bheem Asifabad, Mancherial, and Rajanna Sircilla, where heavy showers are expected at isolated locations.

The IMD Hyderabad weather update cautions that thunderstorms accompanied by lightning and gusty winds (40‚Äì50 kmph) may occur across several districts in Telangana.

For Thursday, heavy to very heavy rain is likely in Bhadradri Kothagudem, Hanmakonda, Hyderabad, Jangaon, Khammam, Mahabubabad, Medchal‚ÄìMalkajgiri, Nalgonda, Ranga Reddy, Siddipet, Suryapet, Warangal, and Yadadri Bhuvanagiri.

Officials advise residents to stay updated through official Telangana IMD alerts and follow safety instructions during the ongoing monsoon in Telangana.

title: Hyderabad rains: GHMC Issues Heavy Rain Alert; 80-150 mm Expected - BizzBuzz
article_text:
Home
Telangana State
Hyderabad rains: GHMC Issues Heavy Rain Alert; 80-150 mm Expected

GHMC warns Hyderabad residents of heavy rains from Aug 13-14 with 80-150 mm expected. Stay alert, avoid waterlogged areas, and follow official updates.

image for illustrative purpose

By Sowmya Sangam

13 Aug 2025 10:20 AM IST

The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has issued a special weather advisory warning residents of expected heavy rainfall starting from the evening of August 13 through August 14 evening.

Authorities forecast precipitation levels between 80 to 150 millimeters over the next 36 hours.

The GHMC has urged the public to remain vigilant and adjust travel plans accordingly to avoid disruptions caused by waterlogging and flooding in vulnerable areas.

Residents are advised to stay updated via official channels and avoid venturing into low-lying zones prone to water accumulation.

Emergency preparedness measures are underway, with GHMC teams positioned across the city for rapid response.

For immediate assistance during emergencies, citizens can contact GHMC helpline at 040-21111111 or dial 100.
